Description:
Credit Benchmark provides Credit Consensus Ratings and Analytics based on contributed risk views from 40+ of the world’s leading financial institutions, almost half of which are GSIBs, domiciled in the US, Continental Europe, Switzerland, UK, Japan, Canada, Australia and South Africa. 

The risk views are collected, aggregated, and anonymized to provide an independent, real-world perspective of credit risk, delivered twice monthly to our partners. Credit Consensus Ratings and Analytics are available on 100,000+ corporate, financial, fund and sovereign entities globally, most of which are unrated by credit rating agencies. Credit Benchmark also produces 1,200 credit indices, which help risk practitioners better understand industry and sector macro trends.

Risk professionals at banks, insurance companies, asset managers and other firms use the data to gain visibility on entities without a public rating, inform risk sharing transactions (CRT / SRT), monitor and be alerted to changes within the portfolio, benchmark, assess and analyze trends, and fulfil regulatory requirements and capital.
Related Content:
1. [Sector Analysis] Sector Analysis – Private Credit Focused Rating Agencies (2026-01-14)
   Private credit ratings have shifted from limited adoption to essential infrastructure for insurers, private credit funds, and institutional investors. Regional challengers and AI‑native entrants expand coverage, accelerate surveillance cadence, and push for transparency – while the Big Three defend their dominance through data depth, regulatory integration, regional acquisitions and selective partnerships.

Description:
The Fact Intelligence Platform.

AI-powered fact extraction, verification and analysis. For legal, compliance, HR, Tax & Forensics teams.

Wexler establishes the facts in any contentious matter, from an internal investigation, to international litigation to an employee grievance. Disputes of any kind rely on a deep understanding of the facts. With Wexler, legal, HR, compliance , forensic accounting and tax teams can quickly understand the facts in any matter, reducing doubt, saving critical time and increasing ROI, through more successful outcomes and fewer written off costs. 

Reduce doubt, establish the facts and find the 'truth'.

Description:
Our award-winning location intelligence services have been helping insurers make better decisions since 2015. Our APIs are built on serverless cloud technology which allows us to scale to the demands of the biggest insurers on the planet. We have built up a team of experts from multiple disciplines who all share a passion for solving complex problems and delighting our customers. Our solutions have won prestigious awards and we are recognised as one of the Top 100 Best Places to work in the UK technology sector.

We are Addresscloud.

Description: Private Equity International (PEI), founded in December 2001, is a global B2B information services provider focused on private equity, private real estate, private debt, infrastructure, and agricultural investing. Headquartered in London with further offices in New York and Hong Kong, PEI publishes digital news, commentary, a monthly magazine (ten editions per year), in-depth supplements, industry awards, specialist books, podcasts, and conferences. Its core offering includes a proprietary subscription-based database containing detailed fund, fund-manager, limited partner (LP), general partner (GP), placement agent, law firm and consultant profiles, along with fundraising metrics, performance benchmarks, and investor calendars. The platform serves institutional investors, fund managers, advisors, lawyers and regulators, enabling research and insights into fundraising, deal flow, LP‑GP relationships and performance trends
Secondary Sectors: Alternative Assets; Institutional Investor Fundraising Intelligence; Private Equity

Description:
MarktoMarket connects M&A advisers and investors to the UK’s most comprehensive and easily searchable database of private market intelligence.

Our customers told us that they were spending weeks manually gathering the data they needed to make informed business decisions – so we did it for them.

We collect, clean and categorise hundreds of thousands of data sources on one simple-to-use dashboard, so our customers can access the information they need in minutes, not weeks.

From deal origination, competitive due diligence and sector screening, through to valuations and buyer research, MarktoMarket streamlines critical workflows and enables users to deliver the best results for their clients.

   Dealroom.co's private company and transaction data platform is an attractive acquisition target for private equity firms and strategic acquirers with ambitions to build big in private markets

Description:
Macro Hive is a leading independent provider of global macro research and strategy. Our worldwide user base spans 160 countries and over 1,000 institutions, with clients including 7 of the top 10 largest banks and the top 5 macro and multi-strategy hedge funds, as ranked by Bloomberg.

Our mission is to give retail and institutional investors a trusted platform to discover the best investment opportunities in an accessible and concise format. To do this, we combine best-in-class human and artificial intelligence, and our team of seasoned experts features ex-heads from global organizations such as JP Morgan, Nomura, Deutsche Bank, the IMF, and the NY Fed.

How Macro Hive Uses Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

At Macro Hive, we believe artificial intelligence and machine learning have an increasingly important role to play in the investment process.
Our team of experienced researchers leverage all the latest technologies, including large language models (LLMs) such as those that power chatbots like ChatGPT, to develop innovative, data-driven solutions to complex financial problems. Specifically, we use predictive analytics, deep learning, and natural language processing to build state-of-the-art models and indicators in search of alpha signals across asset classes.
Corporate Events:
1. Acquisition — Completed (2025-10-06)
   BGC Group acquires of Macro Hive

Description: Aurora Energy Research is a private company founded in 2013 by Dr. John Feddersen, headquartered in Oxford, UK, providing power market forecasting, analytics and advisory services to developers, utilities, financial institutions, energy consumers, and governments worldwide. The firm operates a subscription-based data and software model centered on its EOS platform - featuring tools such as Origin, Amun, Chronos, Lumus and Nodal Explorer - which deliver comprehensive datasets and forecasts on power and renewables, grid analytics (including sub‑hourly pricing and congestion), storage asset valuations, hydrogen markets, carbon, fossil fuel trends, and flexible energy markets. Aurora supports investment decisions, asset siting, PPAs, portfolio valuation and strategy through packaged market outlooks, bespoke advisory and software solutions. Dr. John Feddersen serves as CEO, supported by a senior team drawn from industry, academia and finance. The company maintains a global footprint with 17 offices across Europe, North and South America, Asia and Australia. In 2020, its management team and private equity investors CGE Partners and 22C Capital completed a buyout, transitioning Aurora into a global energy intelligence platform serving over 1,000 institutions in more than 40 markets. On June 4, 2025, TPG Rise Climate announced it would acquire a majority stake, with CGE, 22C and CEO Feddersen reinvesting alongside, marking the latest ownership shift toward TPG's climate-focused investing strategy
Secondary Sectors: Batteries; Battery Energy Storage Sector (BESS); Hydrogen; Power Generation; Renewable Energy; Wind
Corporate Events:

Description: Cirium is an aviation data and analytics company headquartered in London, United Kingdom, providing data services to airlines, airports, aerospace manufacturers, travel companies and financial institutions based on datasets covering airline schedules, routes, fleet information, aircraft configurations, passenger traffic, valuations, flight status and related aviation metrics. The business traces its roots to Flight Magazine, first published in 1909, and the Cirium brand was created in 2019 when Reed Business Information retained the data, analytics and software elements of FlightGlobal and restructured them under the new name Cirium. Its products include Diio, Ascend by Cirium, flight schedule data, aviation fleet and valuations datasets, Cirium Sky, and FlightStats, reflecting earlier acquisitions of Ascend (2011), Innovata (2014), Diio Mi and FlightStats (2016), and Snowflake Software (2020). Cirium operates as part of RELX, a publicly listed information and analytics group traded in London, Amsterdam and New York, and remains under RELX ownership. The company provides data across flight tracking, fleet analytics, aircraft and engine valuations, scheduling, route planning, passenger traffic, emissions, and related aviation insights

2. [Company Analysis] Company Analysis - Osprey Flight Solutions (2025-08-08)
   Osprey Flight Solutions, an aviation risk intelligence platform, was founded in 2017 by Andrew Nicholson, a former Special Forces Officer and security director at MedAire. The company was launched in part as a response to the Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 incident in 2014, which showed the need for real-time Aviation Risk Data & Analytics to enable more effective aviation risk assessment.

Description: Energy Aspects is a London-based company founded in 2012 by Amrita Sen, Fredrik Fosse, and Richard Bronze, providing data analytics and market intelligence across global energy and macro markets. The company offers subscription-based services that include proprietary datasets, forecasts, and analysis covering crude oil, oil products, natural gas, LNG, power, emissions, and methanol, as well as quantitative analytics through EA Quant and transition-focused insights. Its enterprise data packages deliver cross-commodity time series data and predictive models, integrated via APIs and desktop tools, while its client portal provides reports, alerts, and visualization tools for supply-demand balances, price forecasts, and policy impacts. Energy Aspects has expanded its capabilities through acquisitions, including OilX in 2023 for AI-driven real-time crude analytics, It’s Not A Science (rebranded as EA Quant) in 2023 for quantitative strategies, Medley Global Advisors in 2020 for macro policy research, and MMSA in 2024 for methanol market analytics. The company operates globally with offices in New York, Houston, Singapore, Dubai, Kolkata, Tokyo, and Athens. Fredrik Fosse serves as Chief Executive Officer. Energy Aspects is private equity-backed by Summit Partners since 2022
Primary Sectors: Energy & Commodities; Marine & Maritime; Supply Chain; Transportation
